timeline.summary: Psych Ops was discontinued on July 30, 2018, at 8:15 am. The Associate Warden was located at MCC New York, New York, NY 10007, and the file was EFTA00035487.

This document pertains to the case of Reginald Epstein (Reg. No. 76318-054). It includes records of discontinued psychological operations (PSYOPs) that ended on July 30, 2018, at 8:15 am, under the Associate Warden at MCC New York, New York NY 10007. Attachments include files named TEXT_1.htm and 2019_08_10_18_12_55.pdf.

On July 8, 2019, the Associate Warden at MCC New York received a recommendation to conduct a suicide risk assessment on inmate J. Epstein (76318054) upon his return from court due to factors including sex offense charges, a high-profile case, and potential negative legal news. Staff were instructed to immediately notify the psychology department upon his return, and he was to be placed on psychological observation or suicide watch until an assessment could be conducted.

This document is a psych observation report conducted from July 8, 2019, at 6:00 PM to July 10, 2019, at 9:00 AM, utilizing an inmate companion. The report was generated by the Associate Warden at MCC New York.  Attachments include a text file (.htm) and a PDF document (2019 08 12 15 18 11.pdf). The file identifier is EFTA00035223.

Due to a potential negative court outcome, the Associate Warden at MCC New York is recommending a suicide risk assessment for inmate Epstein upon his return from court. If psychology services are unavailable, Epstein will be placed on Psychological Observation or Suicide Watch if he reports suicidal ideation. R&D staff and Lieutenants are instructed to immediately notify the psychology department upon his return, regardless of the time, until an assessment can be conducted.

Following a phone conversation on July 8, 2019, the Associate Warden at MCC New York recommended a suicide risk assessment for inmate J. 76318054 (Epstein) upon his return from court due to factors including media attention, sex offense charges, pre-trial status, and a potential negative legal outcome. Staff were instructed to immediately notify the psychology department if Epstein returned from court, and to place him on a watch status until an assessment could be conducted.

Following a phone consultation with Central Office, the Associate Warden at MCC New York is recommending a suicide risk assessment for inmate Epstein upon his return from court due to his high-risk factors including media attention, sex offense charges, and potential negative court news. If psychology staff are unavailable, Epstein will be placed on Psychological Observation or Suicide Watch, and relevant staff have been instructed to immediately notify the psychology department.

Due to a pending court case involving inmate J. Epstein (76318054), a suicide risk assessment is being recommended by the Associate Warden at MCC New York. Epstein has multiple risk factors, including a high-profile case, sex offense charges, and pre-trial status, as identified by BOP statistics. Upon his return from court, R&D staff and Lieutenants are to immediately notify the psychology department. If psychology is unavailable, on-call psychologists are to place Epstein on a watch status until an assessment can be conducted.

The document is a request for confirmation regarding DNA assignment updates at correctional institutions, specifically referencing DNA PS 5311.01. It requires a response by July 15, 2019, confirming that the institution has reviewed, corrected, and/or added the appropriate DNA assignment. The request originates from the Associate Warden at MCC New York and the Northeast Regional Office.

EFTA00035564 is an Associate Warden with a last updated record of 2019-07-18. It utilizes Groupwise 12.0.3, has a VCard Version of 2.1, and is identified as a User with specific GVVTYPE and GWUDF identifiers.

On July 18, 2019, Associate Warden (O) from FCI Estill communicated that Jeffrey Epstein was not granted bail and returned from court without incident. The communication was sent to [REDACTED] and referenced case number SDNY_00012513 and Epstein’s registration number 76318-054.

On July 18, 2019, an Associate Warden at FCI Estill sent an email regarding Jeffrey Edward Epstein (Reg. No. 76318-054). The email stated that Epstein was not granted bail and returned from court without incident. The email included contact information for FCI Estill.

On July 18, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was not granted bail and returned from court without incident. The communication is from an Associate Warden at FCI Estill regarding this situation, referencing R. Kelly’s lack of bail.

On July 18, 2019, an Associate Warden (O) from FCI Estill sent an email regarding Jeffrey Edward Epstein (Reg. No. 76318-054). The email stated that Epstein was not granted bail and returned from court without incident.

On July 18, 2019, an Associate Warden at FCI Estill informed recipients that Jeffrey Edward Epstein was not granted bail and returned from court without incident. The email chain details this information and expresses surprise at the outcome.
On July 18, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was not granted bail and returned from court without incident. The communication was sent by an Associate Warden (O) regarding case EFTA00035468.

On July 18, 2019, Associate Warden (O) from FCI Estill reported that Jeffrey Epstein was not granted bail and returned from court without incident. The communication is marked as CONFIDENTIAL and includes reference to case numbers SDNY_00008957 and EFTA00033635.

On July 21, 2019, Associate Warden of MCC New York addressed disruptive behavior by inmate Johnson during a Jumah service, leading to a 30-day restriction from chapel services. The Saturday volunteer program was delayed due to training, and a planned gang fight prompted the cancellation of the Sunday Christian service. Inmate Epstein and Encarnacion were added to the CFSA roster, and the Rabbi escorted Jewish inmates, including one in a locked-down unit.

On July 23, 2019, at 7:57 PM, the Associate Warden at MCC New York informed the recipient that they were being released and would see them the following day. The communication was classified as CONFIDENTIAL and referenced case numbers SDNY_00010418 and EFTA00034176.
On July 23, 2019, at 7:57 PM, an Associate Warden at MCC New York informed someone that they were going home and would see them the following day, referencing an attached document (EFTA00035379).

The Associate Warden of MCC New York is providing a redacted analysis of information related to case EFTA00035469. A memo from Captain of the Metropolitan Correctional Center at 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007, is attached.

On July 23, 2019, at 7:00 AM, an I/M companion assumed duties until July 24, 2019, at 8:45 AM. Epstein was transferred to psych observation from July 24, 2019, at 8:45 AM to July 30, 2019, at 8:15 AM, utilizing a UM companion. The Associate Warden was located at 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007. Case numbers SDNY_00011196 and EFTA00034510 were involved.

On July 23, 2019, at 7:00 AM, an “I/M companion” assumed duties from staff until July 24, 2019, at 8:45 AM.  David Epstein was transferred to psych observation from July 24, 2019, at 8:45 AM to July 30, 2019, at 8:15 AM, with the “I/M companion” utilized during this time. The Associate Warden of the MCC New York facility is located at 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007.

On July 23, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was found in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) in a fetal position with red marks on his neck. He reported his cellmate attempted to kill him and had been harassing him, informing his attorney. A medical assessment revealed erythema around his neck, but no signs of injury or distress. He was placed on Suicide Watch and evaluated by a psychologist. Plans were underway to review his case for transfer to the general population in Unit 7 South and find an appropriate cellmate. A request was sent to Associate Warden at MCC New York for a summary of the situation and plans for movement.

A memo from Associate Warden at the MCC New York to Captain at the Metropolitan Correctional Center details a discrepancy between reported information and what was actually received regarding events involving Jeffrey Epstein. The memo includes attachments: a text file named TEXT.htm and a PDF file named 2019_07_23_10_29_05.pdf.

The document is a redacted memo regarding information discrepancies. It details a communication between the Associate Warden of MCC New York and the Captain of Metropolitan Correctional Center New York, referencing a July 23, 2019, communication (SDNY_00011064) and EFTA00034484.

A memo from the Associate Warden of MCC New York to the Captain of the Metropolitan Correctional Center contradicts prior information received. The memo is dated July 23, 2019, at 10:30 AM and pertains to case EFTA00034824.

The attached memo contradicts information received from the Captain at Metropolitan Correctional Center regarding EFTA00034485. The memo was sent on July 23, 2019, at 10:30 AM by Associate Warden Emily Yvirk.

An associate warden at MCC New York is acting on behalf of the Warden due to annual leave. On July 24, 2019, this warden provided information to another individual, who then relayed it to her superiors. On July 25, 2019, an Acting SDAD/CPD contacted the associate warden regarding a difficult situation involving a high-profile prisoner, Jeffrey Epstein, at MCC New York, where obtaining information from the facility was proving challenging.

An inmate, #76318-054 (Jeffrey Epstein), was removed from Suicide Watch and placed on Psychological Observation. He was escorted to Health Services for a follow-up assessment and will subsequently meet with his attorney. The Associate Warden of MCC New York is providing updates to the Regional Director of the Northeast Region.

An Associate Warden at MCC New York is communicating regarding an incident involving a high-profile prisoner, Jeffrey Epstein. The Warden is on annual leave, and the Associate Warden is acting on his behalf. Communication is being directed to the Acting SDAD/CPD at the Federal Bureau of Prisons, who is attempting to obtain basic information about the incident, with limited success due to difficulties reaching the Warden and Assistant Warden.

An email exchange occurred regarding information about an incident involving Jeffrey Epstein at the MCC New York facility. An Associate Warden responded to inquiries about the incident, stating she provided information to her superiors on July 24, 2019. A separate individual contacted the Associate Warden and Acting SDAD/CPD, requesting information and noting difficulties in obtaining it due to the Warden and Assistant Warden being unavailable. The USMS and Chief for the S/New York office were also unsuccessful in obtaining information.

Inmate Epstein #76318-054 was removed from Suicide Watch and placed on Psychological Observation after a Health Services assessment. He is scheduled to meet with his attorney following the assessment. The Associate Warden provided a status update to the Regional Director regarding the inmate’s movements and current observation status.

Inmate Epstein (#76318-054) was removed from Suicide Watch and placed on Psychological Observation due to deteriorated mental status, including disorganized thinking and poor self-care. The Psychological Observation status is a temporary designation for inmates with mental health impairments who are not imminently suicidal. He was escorted to Health Services for an assessment and then to an Attorney Conference. He is currently being held in Special Housing Unit (SHU) with inmate I and has a pending incident report for Self-Mutilation. Epstein pleaded guilty to mailing improvised explosive devices to prominent Democratic figures, including Barack Obama, Hillary Clinton, and Cory Booker. The Associate Warden requested daily updates on the inmate’s status and activities.

The Associate Warden of MCC New York is awaiting a psychologist’s evaluation/assessment of inmate EFTA00035634 and will provide a daily update to the Regional Director, Northeast Region, regarding the inmate’s status and activities. The update request was made on July 24, 2019.

An email chain discusses an incident involving a high-profile prisoner, Jeffrey Epstein, at MCC New York. The sender, [REDACTED], is requesting information from the facility but is encountering difficulties due to unresponsive staff, specifically the Warden and Assistant Warden. The Associate Warden, cc’d on the email, is the point of contact for providing information.

An email is being sent to inquire about information regarding an incident involving a high-profile prisoner, Jeffrey Epstein, at MCC New York. The sender contacted the Associate Warden, who will provide information. The Acting SDAD/CPD of the Federal Bureau of Prisons is also involved and offering assistance.

*   He has been placed on Psychological Observation due to exhibiting unstable behavior, including observed self-harm attempts (a makeshift noose) and refusal to go to general population. *   A psychologist assessed him and determined he would remain on Psychological Observation for another day. *   He is under investigation for a Code 228 (tattooing/self-mutilation) related to the noose incident. *   He is currently housed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and is being considered for cellmate with inmate MI. *   His case is linked to a previous incident involving the mailing of improvised explosive devices to prominent Democratic figures. *   He was previously on Suicide Watch but has been stepped down to Psychological Observation. *   Regular updates and assessments are being conducted by the Associate Warden and Regional Director.

*   He was previously on Suicide Watch and is awaiting assessment and re-evaluation. *   A psychologist will assess him daily over the weekend and again on Monday. *   He is being considered for cellmate placement with inmate M, after reviewing other SHU inmates. *   Epstein is facing charges related to mailing improvised explosive devices to prominent figures, including former presidents and senators. *   His Psychological Observation status is defined as a temporary measure for inmates experiencing mental instability due to impaired mental status, not imminent suicidal ideation. *   The Associate Warden is providing daily updates and coordinating medical assessments and attorney visits.

The Chief Psychologist at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York is following up on concerns from Central Office regarding a patient’s psych obs status. The psychologist intends to re-assess the patient after he finishes showering and dressing to confirm the appropriateness of the recent step-down decision. The Associate Warden is being notified upon completion of the patient's assessment. Additionally, the psychologist confirms receipt of award nominations submitted during a previous absence.

On July 26, 2019, the Chief Psychologist at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York was communicating with the Associate Warden regarding Jeffrey Epstein’s psychological observation. The Chief Psychologist requested updates on Epstein’s assessment, specifically wanting to confirm his current status after concerns from Central Office about a potential downgrade from psych observation to SW. The Associate Warden reported on Epstein’s activities, including being in the shower, and assured the Chief Psychologist that he would revisit Epstein after he was ready. Additionally, the Chief Psychologist mentioned having received award nominations from the Associate Warden.

On July 26, 2019, the Associate Warden at MCC New York is concerned about a prisoner’s psychological observation (psych obs) status, specifically regarding a potential step-down from SW to psych obs. The Chief Psychologist is tasked with assessing the prisoner’s condition and notifying the RD (Regional Director). The Associate Warden intends to re-assess the prisoner after he completes showering and dressing to ensure the decision remains appropriate before an interview. The Chief Psychologist has received nominations for awards submitted by the Associate Warden.

On July 26, 2019, an Associate Warden at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York is requesting an assessment of an inmate’s psychological state before an attorney visit. The Chief Psychologist is coordinating with the Associate Warden and Central Office Psych to ensure the assessment is conducted and justified. The Chief Psychologist also received award nominations from the Associate Warden. A change in the nomination due date was discussed.

On July 26, 2019, the Chief Psychologist at the Metropolitan Correctional Center New York requested an assessment of an inmate (“he”) before an attorney visit, anticipating the inmate would be present throughout the day. The Associate Warden responded and stated they had checked on the inmate but he was in the shower. The Warden instructed the Psychologist to re-assess the inmate after he finished showering and dressing to confirm the psych observation remained appropriate, addressing concerns from Central Office regarding a potential step-down from psych observation to SW. The Psychologist also requested notification to the RD upon completion of the assessment and confirmed receipt of award nominations.

On July 30, 2019, an Associate Warden at MCC New York (150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007) was discussing a project involving “co do M” and a case identified as EFTA00035652 with an unnamed individual.  The discussion included a reference to “Epstein drama.”

On July 30, 2019, IMI contacted Associate Warden at MCC New York regarding facility updates. The Associate Warden responded, stating they were “very busy with Epstein” and would get in contact. The email chain is attached as TEXT.htm.

On July 30, 2019, an Associate Warden at MCC New York discussed a swap involving “Epstein drama” with an unknown recipient.  The conversation included inquiries about work being done on a project referred to as “Ill do” and referenced document EFTA00035651.

On July 30, 2019, an Associate Warden at MCC New York was communicating regarding the status of work assignments for Marshal and Jackson. The communications include inquiries about an individual’s work on a project and updates on assignments. The document is classified as CONFIDENTIAL and references case numbers SDNY_00012641 and EFTA00034845.

On July 30, 2019, IMI contacted Associate Warden at MCC New York to propose a meeting to discuss facilities-related activities. The Associate Warden responded, stating they were extremely busy with Epstein and would get in touch.

This document is a confidential report, specifically the Institution Disciplinary Process Report for inmate Epstein (#68127-054), generated on July 30, 2019, at 12:37 PM. It originates from the Associate Warden at MCC New York, located at 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007. The report is labeled as CONFIDENTIAL and identified by the SDNY_00012639 and EFTA00034844 codes.

On July 31, 2019, an inmate (identified as Epstein) participated in court proceedings from 9:30 am to 11:30 am at Court 9. On July 30, 2019, he was removed from psychological services. A subsequent Suicide Risk Assessment (SRA) was conducted by Dr. = on July 31, 2019, revealing psychological stability. The SRA was prompted by a note from Epstein indicating suicidal tendencies. The Associate Warden (O) at FCI Estill is identified as FCI Estill, 100 Prison Road, Sc 29918.

On August 5, 2019, an Associate Warden at MCC New York inquired about coverage for a specific individual (AVIME). Subsequently, on August 19-23, 2019, an individual (CDR) requested time off for their 22-year marriage anniversary.

On August 5, 2019, CDR requested time off from Associate Warden (AW) for the week of August 19-23, 2019, citing it as his 22-year marriage anniversary. This request was repeated on July 30, 2019. The email chain discusses coverage and the Associate Warden’s response to the time-off request.

On August 5, 2019, CDR requested time off from August 19-23, 2019, citing his 22-year marriage anniversary. A discussion ensued regarding coverage for someone, likely Mr. , and a request was made for him to be present in all capacities. The email chain highlights a request for leave and an inquiry about coverage responsibilities.

An email exchange occurred between SI and Associate Warden (AW) regarding leave for the week of August 19-23, 2019. SI requested the time off to celebrate their 22-year marriage anniversary. The email also included a request to identify coverage for SI’s absence.

On August 6, 2019, Associate Warden, MCC New York, issued a memorandum to York regarding the Annual Assurance Statement for FY 2019 at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York. The memorandum states that a review conducted in accordance with Program Statement 1210.23 indicated effective and efficient management of program activities, providing reasonable assurance that government resources are protected against fraud, mismanagement, or misappropriation.
An email was sent from the Associate Warden of MCC New York to [REDACTED] on August 6, 2019, regarding EFTA00036963. The email is attached as TEXT.htm.
An individual (“Associate Warden” at MCC New York) requested a sample of a checklist used when there is an outgoing bus from a sender (“[REDACTED]”). The request was made via email on August 8, 2019.

An email was sent on August 9, 2019, from the Environmental and Safety Compliance Administrator at the FCC Yazoo City, MS, to the Associate Warden at MCC New York, NY. The email included an updated inspection team list, specifically swapping team 8 and team 1 to include safety staff for food service inspections. The sender also reminded the recipient that inspections were due the following Thursday. Attached documents included: Inspection_Teams.docx, ACA_Inspection_Report.docx, ACA_Walk-Thru_Points.pdf, and Pre-IRP_Mock_Audit.Things_to_Look_For.docx.

On August 10, 2019, at approximately 6:33 a.m., inmate Jeffrey Epstein (Register No. 76318-054) was found unresponsive in his cell. Staff initiated life-saving measures and transported him to Health Services and then to a local hospital where he was pronounced dead at 7:36 a.m. Circumferential bruising around his neck and an orange makeshift noose were discovered in his cell. EMS arrived at 6:59 a.m. and he was transported to the hospital at 7:23 a.m.

On August 10, 2019, the Associate Warden of MCC New York sent an email referencing case file EFTA00035069 and stating they have the “actual bog” available for later use. The email included contact information for the Associate Warden and NYM/AW-Programs@bop.gov.

EFTA00035422 is an Associate Warden with a last updated record of 2019-08-10. Key identifiers include a unique identifier (835B5E40-11C6-0000-B3D6-FE66A7708950), Groupwise 12.0.3 program ID, and VCard version 2.1.  The record also includes several telephone numbers and user/reference identifiers (11(BES User ID)981 and 10(BES Ref ID)0).

On August 10, 2019, an Associate Warden visited inmate Epstein in the SHU at MCC New York. Epstein was preparing to meet with his attorneys, denied mental health concerns and suicidal thoughts, requested specific items (a book and social calls without a speakerphone), and desired to move to the general population. He interacted with a cellmate and exhibited a non-depressed or anxious mood.

On August 10, 2019, an Associate Warden at MCC New York (150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007) sent an email attachment to a Tijuana Doctor. The email included a confidential document identified as SDNY_00009159 and EFTA00033705. The Warden and Doctor exchanged brief acknowledgements confirming receipt.

This document pertains to Jeffrey Edward Epstein, Registration Number 73618-054, and includes a modified copy of his document. It’s a confidential communication from the Associate Warden of MCC New York to an unidentified recipient, dated August 10, 2019, with contact information for the facility. The document is labeled with case identifiers including SDNY_000 10732 and EFTA00034337.

On August 10, 2019, Associate Warden Elissa Visoky visited inmate Jeffrey Epstein in SHU at MCC New York. Epstein was preparing to meet with his attorneys, denied any mental health concerns or suicidal thoughts, and requested specific items and social interactions. He exhibited no signs of distress and was focused on his legal situation.

On August 10, 2019, the Associate Warden of MCC New York sent an email attachment, a "bog" (likely referring to a logbook), regarding Jeffrey Edward Epstein’s case (Reg. No. 73618-054). The email confirms receipt of the logbook for potential future use and includes contact information for the Associate Warden.

On August 10, 2019, an Associate Warden visited inmate Epstein in SHU at MCC New York. Epstein denied mental health concerns, suicidal thoughts, and reported a neutral mood. He requested social calls without a speakerphone, a specific book, and planned to meet with his attorneys regarding his legal situation. He shared a cell with another inmate and had interacted with him.

On August 10, 2019, at 8:58 AM, an Associate Warden at MCC New York was working with IPPA to finalize a press release regarding Jeffrey Epstein’s death. Key details documented include: Epstein’s next of kin had not been notified, staff initiated life-saving measures upon finding him at 6:30 AM, EMS and BOP staff transported him to the local hospital after EMS arrived at the institution, he was pronounced dead at the hospital at 7:36 AM, the FBI was notified and investigating it as a suicide, Epstein’s arrival date at MCC NY was July 6, 2019, and his charges were Sex Trafficking Conspiracy and Sex Trafficking of Minors.

An email chain discusses a “bog” (likely a logbook) related to Jeffrey Epstein, Registration Number 73618-054. The Associate Warden at MCC New York forwarded a logbook to the recipient, referencing it for potential future use. The email includes contact information for MCC New York and a case identifier (SDNY_00009490).

This email chain pertains to Jeffrey Edward Epstein’s case file (Reg. No. 73618-054), specifically regarding Attorney Confidential Log Books (Parts 1-4). An Associate Warden at MCC New York sent an email referencing a physical “bog” (likely a document) and an attached HTML file (“TEXT.htm”). A reply confirms receipt of the attached file and reference to the EFTA00035208 case file.

This document pertains to Jeffrey Edward Epstein, Registration Number 73618-054, and specifically his attorney conference log books (Parts 1-4). It includes email correspondence from the Associate Warden at the MCC New York facility. Attached files include HTML text, PDFs of the attorney conference parts, and contact information for the facility.

This document is a redaction analysis related to Jeffrey Edward Epstein’s Bureau of Prisons (BOP) records, specifically pertaining to BEMR (Behavioral Observation Program and Risk Assessment) records. It includes emails exchanged between the Associate Warden at MCC New York and [REDACTED], discussing records from parts 1-5 of Epstein's BEMR assessment. Attached files include HTML text and PDF versions of the BEMR assessment documents. The file identifier is EFTA00035179.

EFTA00035215 is an Associate Warden with the following details: *   **Last Updated:** 2019-08-12 05:00:46 +0000 *   **Job Title:** Associate Warden *   **Unique Identifier:** 835B5E40-11C6-0000-B3D6-FE66A7708950 *   **Program ID:** //-Novell Inc//Groupwise 12.0.3 *   **VCard Version:** 2.1 *   **X-GVVTYPE:** USER *   **X-GWUDF:** 11(BES User ID)981, 10(BES Ref ID)0

This document is a redaction analysis related to case file EFTA00035218. It concerns Jeffrey Edward Epstein (Reg. No. 73618-054) and includes updates regarding a timeline involving the warden and OIG, scheduled to arrive on Sunday, and contact information for the Associate Warden at MCC New York.

This email concerns a medical mortality review for Jeffrey Edward Epstein, Registration Number 73618-054. It originated from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED] with CCs to [REDACTED]. The email is dated August 12, 2019, and references attachments including “IF/CTMal,” “FYI,” “Associate Warden,” and “MCC New York.” The document is identified as EFTA00036033.

This document is a chronological log concerning Jeffrey Epstein, registered as Edward with Reg. No. 73618-054, while incarcerated at MCC New York. It was sent on August 12, 2019, from the Associate Warden and includes references to “SW Chronological Log 7/23-24/19 re: Epstein, Jeffrey” and “TEXT.htm” and “ .vcf”. The document is classified as CONFIDENTIAL and includes the case number SDNY_00009678 and file number EFTA00033954.

This document, dated August 12, 2019, is a communication from an Associate Warden at the MCC New York facility (150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007) regarding Software and Psychological Operations (S/W and Psych Ops) documents. The document is labeled EFTA00035063.

An email was sent from the Associate Warden of MCC New York to an unknown recipient regarding a “Watch Call.” The Warden expresses concern about the recipient’s well-being following a recent inmate suicide and offers assistance. An attached file named “TEXT.htm” was included.

A staff watch was initiated regarding Jeffrey Epstein. The initial log used was the “tIM companion log” instead of the “Staff Suicide Watch log.” David Coates corrected the error, creating a second log using the correct “Suicide Watch log,” which contained identical entries. The Associate Warden at MCC New York was also involved.

On August 12, 2019, the Associate Warden of MCC New York sent an email to an unknown recipient (“To:”) regarding a “Wwatch Call.” The email expresses gratitude and requests prayers, and offers support (“Call me if you need anything.”) The sender identifies themselves as the Associate Warden of MCC New York, located in New York, New York.

An email exchange regarding a psychological observation of Jeffrey Edward Epstein (Reg. No. 73618-054) conducted between 7/8/19 6 pm and 7/10/19 at 9 am. One party sent emails with attachments (“TEXT.htm”) related to the observation, but the recipient reported receiving corrupted files with the error “document cannot be opened because it is corrupted or damaged.” The email chain includes correspondence between the Associate Warden of MCC New York and a recipient, [REDACTED], and Lamine N’Diaye <Indiaye@bop.gov>. The file identifier is EFTA00035071.

On August 12, 2019, at 12:08 PM, an Associate Warden from MCC New York sent a message to EFTA00036908, expressing support and offering assistance during a stressful time. The message included a brief expression of gratitude and a request for prayers.

An Associate Warden at the MCC New York is resending four emails. One email, dated August 12, 2019, reports an issue with a document (Jeffrey Edward Epstein’s case file, Reg. No. 73618-054) being corrupted and unable to open. The email was sent from [REDACTED] and included attachments.

An email exchange occurred between the Associate Warden of MCC New York and an individual identified as [REDACTED] on August 12, 2019. The email chain involved inquiries about the recipient’s well-being and offers of assistance. An attached file named “TEXT.htm” was also sent.

This document is an email chain related to a case file, EFTA00035210. The email, dated August 12, 2019, originates from the Associate Warden of MCC New York and includes attachments: a text file, a PDF document, and the subject line "memos."

A communication dated August 12, 2019, from the Associate Warden at MCC New York to [REDACTED], regarding Jeffrey Edward Epstein (Reg. No. 73618-054), containing the phrases "S/W and Psych Ops" and "CONFIDENTIAL." The email was sent from [REDACTED] and referenced case number SDNY_00009123 and file EFTA00033692.

This document pertains to Jeffrey Edward Epstein, Registration No. 73618-054, and includes psychological observation reports from July 8th and 24th, 2019, along with chronological logs of Social Work activities from July 23rd and 24th, 19. It originates from the Associate Warden at MCC New York, referencing documents related to S/W and psych ops, and is classified as CONFIDENTIAL.

The Associate Warden at MCC New York requests a review of the attached Supplement to ensure it’s up-to-date. They propose incorporating Naloxone into the existing Supplement instead of creating a new one, citing practice at other institutions.
On August 12, 2019, the Associate Warden of MCC New York checked in with an individual, inquiring about their well-being and offering assistance.

This email discusses a medical mortality review for Jeffrey Edward Epstein, Registration Number 73618-054. It originates from the Associate Warden of MCC New York and includes attachments such as a .htm file, a medical mortality review document, and related correspondence. The email is dated August 12, 2019, and concerns a redaction analysis for file EFTA00035217.

An email exchange occurred between a Senior Attorney at the FCC Victorville and an Associate Warden at MCC New York. The Senior Attorney confirmed they had been at MCC for almost three years and expressed gratitude for prayers. The Associate Warden sent prayers for the Senior Attorney and another individual and their crew. Both parties acknowledged the email as sensitive and privileged information belonging to the U.S. Department of Justice, with instructions on how to handle potential errors.

This document pertains to Jeffrey Edward Epstein (Reg. No. 73618-054) and includes several related documents: a text file (TEXT.htm), psychological observation reports from July 8-30 and July 24-30, 2019, a social work chronological log from July 23 & 24, 19, a social work chronological log from July 23, 19, and correspondence from the Associate Warden at MCC New York regarding S/W and psych ops documents.

On July 23-24, 2019, an I/M companion assumed duties until July 24, 8:45 am, observing Jeffrey Epstein. Epstein was transferred to psych observation from July 24, 8:45 am to July 30, 8:15 am, with a WM companion utilized during that time. The document originates from the Associate Warden of MCC New York.

An email dated August 12, 2019, from the Associate Warden at MCC New York to [REDACTED] regarding a “SW Chronological Log 7/23-24/19 re: Epstein, Jeffrey Edward, Reg. No. 73618-054.” The email includes attachments named TEXT.htm and unnamed files, and references Jeffrey Edward Epstein’s registration number. The email states the sender forgot to include a CC recipient.

An Associate Warden at MCC New York was communicating with an individual regarding a situation involving constant contact with others and a recall. The Warden expressed concern for the well-being of those involved, emphasized the importance of discretion regarding media communication, and anticipated a visit from an RD and entourage. The individual confirmed they were "ok" and requested support, with the Warden offering assistance and urging prayers for the staff and first responders.

On August 13, 2019, Associate Warden from FMC Fort Worth sent an email to Associate Warden of MCC New York. The email inquired about the recipient’s well-being and offered assistance. Contact information for both individuals was included: FMC Fort Worth’s address and phone number, and MCC New York’s address and phone number. The email subject was "Re: Hello."

Three separate communications occurred on August 14, 2019, involving individuals associated with correctional facilities. On August 14, 2019, an Associate Warden at MCC New York sent an email to OAKAFORD regarding an inmate’s work assignment (PLUMBING) and a specific subject line indicator (b45cf89c-8580-4ec9-91a2-aaabdb84914d) for email communication. The inmate responded with complaints about the medication’s side effects (migraines, metallic taste) and questioned the medical staff's decision-making process, expressing frustration and accusing the psychiatrist of negligence, referencing Epstein. A second email was sent on August 13, 2019, reiterating the inmate’s complaints and accusations.

An Associate Warden communicated expectations to staff regarding accountability, timely paperwork submission, leave requests, and comp time approval. Specifically, staff are expected to have acting coverage when absent, submit T&A and leave requests through WEBTA, avoid communication via voicemail/text, and have comp time pre-approved. A one-on-one meeting to discuss these and other expectations is planned.

On August 14, 2019, an Associate Warden at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York sent an email to the Captain and Lieutenants regarding non-implementation of overtime procedures. The current procedures, established in May, involve the D/W and E/W Operations Lieutenants filling overtime shifts using an overtime sign-up list and volunteers. If the list is exhausted, the other lieutenant completes the remaining shifts. Operations Lieutenants are required to annotate daily logs when overtime hiring procedures are completed. A reminder of these procedures was also sent on May 25, 2018.

The Associate Warden expects the following from staff: 1.  Staff supervisors are responsible for their staff’s accountability, including ensuring adequate acting coverage when absent. 2.  All paperwork, particularly T&A submissions, must be submitted through WEBTA in a timely manner. 3.  All leave requests for the remainder of the year must be submitted with prior discussion and entered into WEBTA. 4.  Contact the Associate Warden directly via BOP cell phone for absences, rather than voicemail or text. 5.  Comp time must be pre-approved by the Associate Warden, with a completed Comp Sheet routed for review. Additional expectations will be discussed in a future in-person meeting.
